subject: Q: Pithy descriptions of a PRogrammer Test
msgSnippet: Hello, again. I apologize in advance for doing this -- I ll probably do it frequently over the next few months. I should probably just start my own Yahoo!
messageBody:
Hello, again.

I apologize in advance for doing this -- I'll probably do it frequently over the next few months. I should probably just start my own Yahoo! group. :)

I'm looking for pithy descriptions of the structure of a programmer test. I have often written

* Create an object
* Invoke a method
* Check the result

I know that Bill Wake had a phrase with all one-word descriptions that was probably alliterative, but Google won't magically find it for me.

Please send me or point me to any good catch-phrases you have for what a programmer test looks like. <jbr@...>

Thanks.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
telephone: +1 416 791-8603
